results.title: No help wanted
results.creator_credit: Orlando Lippert and Wilding Picture Productions
results.brief_description: This film is a study of the rehabilitation of disabled American servicemen of both world wars, showing not only their training during hospitalisation, but their mastery of many jobs in industry. The film makes it clear that a handicapped veteran is not a business liability, but on the contrary is an efficient and reliable worker. The insurance companies’ attitude is an indication of the esteem in which the disabled veteran worker is held.

results.title: No frontiers for kilowatts
results.brief_description: An essential step for European cooperation has been reached in the field of energy supply. The continually changing requirements of electricity at different times of day, different seasons and weather conditions, is being supplied by power plants. With voltages up to 380,000 volts high tension wires thousands of miles long cross the frontier and provide power to all European countries.

results.title: No easy answer
results.creator_credit: L. Joseph Stone, Anti-Defamation League and Vassar College, Dept. of Child study
results.brief_description: Deals with the problem of prejudice against Jewish children. When a six-year-old Jewish girl indicates that she was involved in an antisemitic incident, her parents and their friends discuss the problem. They recall their own childhood experiences of such situations. Different approaches on the problem of protecting children from attacks are suggested. The film promotes discussion of situations involving prejudice.

results.title: No bag limit
results.creator_credit: Andrew Vial and Andric Film Productions
results.brief_description: David Gulpilil dances in the bush with music and commentary about Aboriginal culture in the background. Tries to express the philosophy of the Aboriginal culture where things, nature, animals, spirits and humans are all interrelated to one huge, spiritual oneness.

results.title: Nixon: a self portrait
results.brief_description: Originally telecast by CBS in the latter part of the 1968 presidential campaign, Mr Nixon talks informally about his boyhood and family. He discusses his motivations for running for president and his thoughts on American and presidential responsibilities in the world in the years ahead.

results.title: Nitrous oxide, oxygen, ether, anaesthesia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Technique of anaesthesia”.
This film shows the working of a typical apparatus designed to deliver a continuous flow on nitrous oxide to the patient. Ether in varied quantities can be added to the mixture of gases as required. One animated diagram sequence in the film deals with the way in which the machine works; another deals with the principle of re-breathing. Induction and maintenance of anaesthesia are demonstrated with emphasis rather on the use of the machine than on general principles.

results.title: Nitric acid
results.creator_credit: Harry H Sisler, Sutherland Educational Films and Chem Study (Manufacturing Chemists Assoc Inc U S A)
results.brief_description: With live action and animation applies fundamental principles to the descriptive chemistry of nitric acid. Demonstrates how nitric acid may act as an acid, as a base, and as an oxidising agent.
